channel.title: A real blog's blog
channel.description: Recent content on A real blog's blog

item.title: Openstack Summit 2017 US
item.description: Machine Learning on Kubernetes (my talk) Recording Slides There was a mix of experience levels among attendees in regards to deep learning. I tried to take a “build up” approach to demonstrate why running these types of workloads atop kubernetes is beneficial. This talk weighed toward the beginner level of detail. Many individuals were interested in how these types of systems can be managed and shared. I heard Magnum brought up a few times, but it does not seem to be meeting many use-cases.

item.title: It Me
item.description: Christopher M Luciano is an Advisory Software Developer for IBM Digital Business group. He currently worksfull-time on Kubernetes and other Cloud Native Computing Foundation (CNCF) projects. Prior to IBM DBG, Christopher was the lead on the Watson container runtime squad. He has previously spoken at Pittsburgh based meetup (Code and Supply) on infrastructure and software operations. Christopher has 3 terrific cats and one hyper dog.
